info.title: Egress from Dwelling Units
info.subtitle: Volume II - 9.9.9.
info.description: Ensure your dwelling unit has exits or egress doors that pass code.

9991.sectionTitle: 9.9.9.1. Travel limit to Exits or Egress Doors

P01.questionText: Does the Building Code apply to this structure?

P02.questionText: Check all that apply to the following structure in this project.

possibleAnswers.answerDisplayText: This project will involve the construction or design of a new <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will result in a change in <defined-term>occupancy</defined-term>.
The project will result in an <defined-term>alteration</defined-term> to an existing <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will result in an addition to an existing <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will result in the demolition of an existing <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will consist of the repair of a <defined-term>building</defined-term> that has been damaged by fire, earthquake, or other causes of damage.
The project will correct unsafe conditions in or about a <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will involve changes that will affect the <defined-term override-term='occupancy'>occupied</defined-term> parts of the <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will involve work necessary to ensure safety in the remaining parts of a <defined-term>building</defined-term> after demolition.
The project will involve work necessary to ensure safety in parts affected but not directly involved in an <defined-term>alteration</defined-term> to the <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will involve work necessary to ensure safety in parts affected but not directly involved in an addition to the <defined-term>building</defined-term>.

The project will involve the installation, replacement, or <defined-term>alteration</defined-term> of materials or equipment regulated by this Code (except as permitted by the British Columbia Fire Code).
This project will involve the work necessary to ensure safety in a relocated <defined-term>building</defined-term> during and after the relocation.
This project will affect safety during construction of a <defined-term>building</defined-term>, including protection of the public.
This project will involve the design, installation, extension, <defined-term>alteration</defined-term>, renewal or repair of plumbing systems.

This project will involve the <defined-term>alteration</defined-term>, rehabilitation and change of <defined-term>occupancy</defined-term> of <defined-term override-term='heritage building'>heritage buildings</defined-term>.

possibleInvalidAnswers.errorMessage: 'None of the above' cannot be selected at the same time as other answers

P03.questionText: Check all that apply to the following apply to this project?

possibleAnswers.answerDisplayText: This project consists of sewage, water, electrical, telephone, rail or similar public infrastructure systems located in a <defined-term>street</defined-term> or a public transit right of way.

This project consists of utility towers and poles, and television, radio and other communication aerials and towers, except for loads resulting from their being located on or attached to <defined-term override-term='building'>buildings</defined-term>.
This project consists of mechanical or other equipment and appliances not specifically regulated in these regulations.
This project consists of flood control and hydro electric dams and structures.
This project consists of accessory buildings less than 10 m<sup>2</sup> in <defined-term>building area</defined-term> that do not create a hazard.

This project has permission of the <defined-term  override-term='authority having jurisdiction'>authorities having jurisdiction</defined-term> to provide construction site offices, seasonal storage buildings, special events facilities, emergency facilities, and/or similar structure.

This project consists of Factory-built housing and components complying with CSA-Z240 MH Series standard, but this exemption does not extend to on site preparations (siting, foundations, mountings), connection to services and installation of appliances.

possibleInvalidAnswers.errorMessage: 'None of the above' cannot be selected at the same time as other answers

P05.questionText: Does this project involve the <defined-term>alteration</defined-term> of an existing <defined-term>building</defined-term>?

P06.questionText: Which <defined-term override-term='major occupancy'>major occupancies</defined-term> will be included in this <defined-term>building</defined-term>?

possibleAnswers.answerDisplayText: <defined-term override-term='major occupancy' override-tooltip='group a division 1'>Group A Division 1.</defined-term>
<defined-term override-term='major occupancy'override-tooltip='group a division 2'>Group A Division 2.</defined-term>
<defined-term override-term='major occupancy' override-tooltip='group a division 3'>Group A Division 3.</defined-term>
<defined-term override-term='major occupancy' override-tooltip='group a division 4'>Group A Division 4.</defined-term>
<defined-term override-term='major occupancy' override-tooltip='group b division 1'>Group B Division 1.</defined-term>
<defined-term override-term='major occupancy' override-tooltip='group b division 2'>Group B Division 2.</defined-term>
<defined-term override-term='major occupancy' override-tooltip='group b division 3'>Group B Division 3.</defined-term>
<defined-term override-term='major occupancy' override-tooltip='group f division 1'>Group F Division 1.</defined-term>
<defined-term override-term='major occupancy' override-tooltip='group f division 2'>Group F Division 2.</defined-term>
<defined-term override-term='major occupancy' override-tooltip='group f division 3'>Group F Division 3.</defined-term>

possibleInvalidAnswers.errorMessage: 'None of the above' cannot be selected at the same time as other answers

P07.questionText: Is the <defined-term>building area</defined-term> of this <defined-term>building</defined-term> greater than 600 m<sup>2</sup>?

P08.questionText: How many <defined-term override-term='storey'>storeys</defined-term> in <defined-term>building height</defined-term> will this building be?

P2.questionText: How many <defined-term override-term='storey'>storeys</defined-term> does this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have?

P3.questionText: Which <defined-term override-term='storey'>storeys</defined-term> within the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> are provided with an egress or <defined-term>exit</defined-term> doors?

P5.questionText: Which level(s) with greater than 1 storey of travel to an <defined-term>exit</defined-term> of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have access to a balcony?

P6.questionText: Is this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> above another <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term>?

P7.questionText: Which level(s) of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have access to an openable window that is at least 1m high and 0.55m wide?

P8.questionText: Which level(s) of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have less than 1m of the finish floor level and less than 7m above adjacent ground level?

P9.questionText: On which level(s) is the door an egress door to a <defined-term>public corridor</defined-term>, enclosed <defined-term>exit</defined-term> stair, or passageway?

P10.questionText: On which level(s) is the egress door an <defined-term>exit</defined-term> doorway not more than 1.5m above adjacent ground level?

P11.questionText: How many <defined-term override-term='dwelling unit'>dwelling units</defined-term> are in this <defined-term>building</defined-term>?

P12.questionText: Is this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> provided with at least two separate <defined-term>means of egress</defined-term>?

P13.questionText: Does this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term>s egress door open onto a <defined-term>public corridor</defined-term> or an exterior passageway?

P14.questionText: Where the egress door opens onto the corridor or exterior passageway, is it possible to go in opposite directions to 2 separate <defined-term override-term='exit'>exits</defined-term>?

P15.questionText: Does the egress door of this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> open onto a corridor that meets the requirements of <pdf-download-link number='99731' named-dest='9.9.7.3. Dead-End Corridors'>Sentence 9.9.7.3.(1)</pdf-download-link>?

P17.questionText: Does this <defined-term>building</defined-term> meet the definition of a <defined-term>secondary suite</defined-term>?

P18.questionText: Is this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> located above another <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> or common space?

P19.questionText: Does the egress door of this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> open onto a shared egress facility (corridor, passageway, stair, <defined-term>ramp</defined-term>, etc.) that is served by a single stair or <defined-term>ramp</defined-term>?

P20.questionText: Does the egress door of this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> open onto an <defined-term>exit</defined-term> stair, <defined-term>public corridor</defined-term>, exterior passageway, or balcony, that serves more than one <defined-term>suite</defined-term>?

P21.questionText: The egress door of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> opens onto ...

P22.questionText: Is the <defined-term>public corridor</defined-term> served by a single <defined-term>exit</defined-term>?

P23.questionText: Is the <answer-value answer='P21'></answer-value> served by a single <defined-term>exit</defined-term> stairway or <defined-term>ramp</defined-term>?

P24.questionText: Is the <answer-value answer='P21'></answer-value> no more than 1.5m above adjacent ground level?

R00.resultDisplayMessage: You have selected an answer that indicates that the BC Building Code 2024 does not apply to this structure. This tool is used to assist building code users in determining the applicable requirements for their building, as such all structures that are not governed by the BC Building Code 2024 are beyond the scope of this tool.

R01.resultDisplayMessage: You have selected {passedAnswerValue}. This indicates that some or all of this structure may not be governed by the BC Building Code 2024. This tool has been designed to assist BC Building Code 2024 users in determining the Building Code requirements for Part 9 buildings. Based on your selection, some or all of your project is beyond the scope of this tool at this time.

R02.resultDisplayMessage: You have selected an option that indicates that this building is a heritage building. Heritage buildings have alternative measures for Building Code compliance. These alternative measures are beyond the scope of this tool at this time. Please see in <pdf-download-link>Table 1.1.1.1.(5)</pdf-download-link> of Division A - Section 1.1 General for more information.

R03.resultDisplayMessage: You have selected an option that indicates that this building is an alteration to an existing building. Alteration to existing buildings have alternative measures for Building Code compliance. These alternative measures are beyond the scope of this tool at this time. Please see Sentences <pdf-download-link>1.1.1.1(6)</pdf-download-link> and <pdf-download-link>1.1.1.2.(1)</pdf-download-link>, and <pdf-download-link>Table 1.1.1.1.(6)</pdf-download-link> in Division A - Section 1.1 General for more information.

R04.resultDisplayMessage: Based on the options you have selected this project does not contain a Group C residential occupancy. This tool is designed to assist BC Building Code 2024 users in evaluating the prescriptive requirements of the BC Building Code for Part 9 Group C residential occupancy buildings, therefore your project is beyond the scope of this tool at this time.

R05.resultDisplayMessage: Based on the options you have selected; this project is not a Part 9 building. This tool is designed to assist BC Building Code 2024 users in evaluating the Acceptable Solutions in Division B of the BC Building Code for Part 9 buildings, therefore your project is beyond the scope of this tool at this time.

R10.resultDisplayMessage: Based on the building characteristics provided, this dwelling unit meets the provision of Subsection <building-code reference='9.9.9'>9.9.9. Egress from Dwelling Units</building-code-link>.

R11.resultDisplayMessage:
Based on the provided building characteristics the dwelling unit must be provided with:
  • an exterior passageway that has a floor assembly with a fire-resistance rating less than 45 min, and
  • be served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and
  • be located more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level, to meet the provisions of the BC Building Code 2024.

R20.resultDisplayMessage: The dwelling unit has not been provided with sufficient means of egress per the building characteristics provided and Subsection <building-code reference='9.9.9'>9.9.9. Egress from Dwelling Units</building-code-link> of the BC Building Code 2024.

R30.resultDisplayMessage: Based on the building characteristics provided this dwelling unit or building is not governed by Part 9 of the Building Code or is not a dwelling unit. This tool is only designed to address the egress from dwelling units of Part 9 buildings.
